text:
Date of incorporation - 1739. Population - 92,000. Land area - 50 square miles.



Located on the banks of the Cape Fear River and the Inter-coastal waterway

in New Hanover County, Wilmington is the cultural, educational and economic

center of southeastern North Carolina. First chartered in 1739, Wilmington is

named after Spencer Compton the Earl of Wilmington in England.



First settled in 1733, the town was originally called New Carthage, New

Liverpool and then Newton or New Town. In 1739, Royal Governor Gabriel

Johnson moved the colonial capital of North Carolina from Brunswick Town to

New Town and changed the name to Wilmington in honor of Spencer Compton,

his patron and benefactor.
title: Photos of Wilmington
